name: polystyrene foam slab for perimeter insulation | polystyrene foam slab for perimeter insulation | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9555/documentation

This dataset represents the production of polystyrene foam insulation for perimeter insulation. The density of the insulation is 33 kg/m3 and the thermal conductivity is 0.033 W/m*K. The production includes the raw materials, the transport of raw materials, the expanding of the polystyrene granulate and the forming of insulation slabs. For the inventory it was assumed that the energy used for the foaming and the forming of the slabs is independent of the densitiy of the final product. Hence per kilogram of material input it was considered that the consumption of energy is the same for all polystyrene foam slabs produced at the company that was inventoried.

From the reception of polystyrene granulate, graphite and polystyrene waste at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the finished product at the production plant. The dataset includes the raw materials as well as transports and the energy required for the transformation into the final product. The dataset does not include the packaging of the final product.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Swiss average EPS production; process from 2 factories in Switzerland. The polystyrene granulate which contains pentane is expanded with steam. In a thermoforming process the expanded granulate is formed into slabs and finally cut to the desired dimensions.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from 2 factories from Swisspor on the consumption of raw materials, energy carriers (electricity, gas, oil), recycled wastes and transports.

flow.name: polystyrene foam slab for perimeter insulation
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

exchanges.description: Calculated value: For the calculation of the oil used for the foaming of the granulate and the forming of the insulation slabs it was assumed that this input depends of the mass of the material input since the energy required for foaming and forming depends mainly on the mass of the raw material that needs to be heated. The calculation of the value is based on the yearly energy consumption of the producer where oil represents a share of 37% . The energy required for the forming of the slabs had to be put into relation to the total mass of the inputs of granulate and recycled material for all products whereas the energy consumption of the foaming process applies only to the total input of granulate. According to an estimation of Swisspor the energy required for the forming of the slabs is about double the one required for the foaming process. The calculated inputs of oil per kilogram of granulate are: 0.901 MJ/kg for foaming and 1.802 MJ/kg for forming.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: For the calculation of the electricity used for the foaming of the granulate and the forming of the insulation slabs it was assumed that this input depends of the mass of the material input since the energy required for foaming and forming depends mainly on the mass of the raw material that needs to be heated. The calculation of the value is based on the yearly energy consumption of the producer where electricity represents a share of 27% . The energy required for the forming of the slabs had to be put into relation to the total mass of the inputs of granulate and recycled material for all products whereas the energy consumption of the foaming process applies only to the total input of granulate. According to an estimation of Swisspor the energy required for the forming of the slabs is about double the one required for the foaming process. The calculated inputs of electricity per kilogram of granulate are: 0.187 kWh/kg for foaming and 0.373 kWh/kg for forming.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Calculated value: For the calculation of the natural gas used for the foaming of the granulate and the forming of the insulation slabs it was assumed that this input depends of the mass of the material input since the energy required for foaming and forming depends mainly on the mass of the raw material that needs to be heated. The calculation of the value is based on the yearly energy consumption of the producer where natural gas represents a share of 36% . The energy required for the forming of the slabs had to be put into relation to the total mass of the inputs of granulate and recycled material for all products whereas the energy consumption of the foaming process applies only to the total input of granulate. According to an estimation of Swisspor the energy required for the forming of the slabs is about double the one required for the foaming process. The calculated inputs of natural gas per kilogram of granulate are: 0.873 MJ/kg for foaming and 1.746 MJ/kg for forming.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: One kilogram of polystyrene granulate contains approximately 40 g of pentane. During the foaming process about 67% (27 g) are emitted and treated in the factory. Only about 4% of the pentane emitted during the foaming process are emitted into the atmosphere (approx. 1 g of pentane per kilogram of granulate). The remaining 13 g of pentane are still in the product at the end of the production.

flow.name: Pentane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value: Per mole of pentane 5 moles of CO2 are emitted  (molar mass pentane 72.15 g/mole, molar mass CO2 44.01 g/mole). Therefore 3.0499 kg CO2 are emitted per kg of pentane.
